question_text: Which of the following best describes how a SATA-based SSD differs from an M.2 NVMe drive?
answer_options: SATA SSDs have higher read/write speeds
M.2 drives install into traditional 2.5 inch bays
M.2 drives connect directly to the motherboard without cables
SATA SSDs are incompatible with operating systems newer than Windows 7
correct_answer: M.2 drives connect directly to the motherboard without cables
explanation: M.2 drives plug directly into the motherboard, while SATA SSDs use cabling and 2.5 inch bays.
